attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Daisy Davies, a renowned dramatist and educator, should be honoured with a National Day to remember her services to Education. She has always been a much loved and treasured member of the teaching profession, and should be honoured accordingly.

If the man who created Wallace and Gromit can receive a birthday list honour from the Queen, then Daisy Davies deserves at least a special day.

Everyone to wear purple on this day, and to spray lavender mist wherever they go.

Suggested date for this holiday: 9th December.

Any money raised in doing so to be donated to a charity of the Prime Minister's choice.

reasons: Intended to be humorous, or has no point about government policy
